text.p: Port conditions from Lloyds Shipping Intelligence Service --

BANGLADESH, Nov 5 - Chittagong - 16 Vessels in port of which 6 general cargo loaders, 3 foodgrain, 1 cement, 1 fertiliser, 4 containers, 1 under repair. 20 Due by 12/11 of which 10 containers, 1 food grain, 3 cement clinker, 2 general cargo import, 1 fertiliser, 3 others.

INDIA, Nov 5 - Bombay - No labour problems. Five vessels loading at berth, 19 discharging, 3 discharging at anchorage, 6 waiting at anchorage to load, 16 waiting to discharge.1 Bunkering, 6 under repair, 2 awaiting orders. Delays expected, containers 2-3 days, bulkers 5-6 days, general cargo 3-4 days. Calcutta - Nine vessels loading at berth, 8 discharging at berth, 1 discharging at anchorage, 2 bunkering. 22 vessels due with following delays, coking coal 5 days, products tankers 8 days, containers 7 days, cRude tankers/palmolein 1 day. Cochin - No labour problems. Vessels due, 1 container loader/discharger, 1 breakbulk loader/discharger (up to 1 days delay for discharging). 1 Fertiliser discharger (mop/dap/urea), 1 fertiliser discharger (rock phosphate/sulphur/steel/grain), 1 general cargo (all up to 1 days delay for discharging). 1 scrap (delay depends on receiver's readiness to receive direct delivery), 1 crude tanker discharger (1-2 days delay), 2 petroleum products tankers (no delays expected) 2 tankers waiting at anchorage (1 crude oil, 1 phosphoric acid). 2 Vessels dry-docked. SW Monsoon affecting operations to some extent.

Mormugao - No labour problems. Three vessels loading at berth, 3 loading at anchor, 1 discharging at berth. 4 Waiting at anchor to load 1 bunkering, 4 under repair/dry-docked, 1 awaiting orders. Vessels due, 1 containers, 1 phosphoric acid (with up to 1 days delay expected), 9 ore (with 4-5 days delay expected). Kandla - Four vessels loading at berth, 4 discharging at berth, 9 waiting at anchorage to load, 1 waiting to discharge. 21 Tankers waiting. Delays, rice/aluminium products 6-7 days, Containers/rock phosphate 3-4 days. Mangalore - No labour problems. Six vessels loading at berth, 4 discharging, 4 loading/discharging at anchorage, 1 awaiting berth.

Madras - Seven loading at berth, 9 discharging at berth, 2 waiting at anchorage to load, 12 waiting to discharge, 2 under repair/dry-docked. 34 Due of which 5 coal/coke, 2 edible oil, 8 containers, 8 general cargo, 3 steel, 3 barytes, 2 others. Delays coal/coke/scrap 5-6 days, fertiliser 4-5 days, containers/iron ore 1-2 days, others 2-3 days. Rains experienced during the night. Jawaharlal Nehru - No labour problems. Two vessels discharging at berth (fertiliser/raw materials), 1 waiting at anchor to discharge oil/iron ore, 3 waiting to discharge fertiliser/raw materials, 1 due (oil/iron ore) with up to 1 days berthing delay expected, 15-20 Days berthing delay expected for fertiliser/raw materials vessels.

Paradip - No labour problems. One vessel loading at berth, 4 vessels waiting at anchorage to load, 1 bunkering. Vessels due/delays 2 coal, 1 chrome, 1 iron ore (no delays), 1 fertiliser vessel loading at berth, 4 days delay. Tuticorin - No labour problems. Four vessels loading at berth, 6 discharging, 1 discharging at anchorage, 1 waiting at anchorage to discharge, 1 due, 1-2 days delay. Visakhapatnam - Five vessels loading at berth, 6 discharging, 5 waiting at anchorage to load, 8 to discharge. No vessel nominated to lift bunkers. If bunkers are to be supplied, can be effected at cargo berths at inner/outer harbour by barge or truck. Vessels due/delays 2 iron ore, 1 export alumina, 1 export containers (up to 1 days delay), 1 export wire coils, 1 export granite blocks, 1 import dap, 2 import coking coal, 1 import sulphur, 1 import iron ore, 1 import bentonite (7-8 days delay), 1 export molasses, 1 export ethyl alcohol, 2 import limestone (3-4 days delay), 1 import general cargo (with 2-3 days delay).

MALAYSIA - Nov 6 - Port Kelang - North port container berths - 4 Vessels berthed, 2 berthing 6/11. Deep draft conventional wharf - 4 Vessels berthed, 3 berthing 6/11, 7 waiting, 3 due 7/11 with 5 days waiting time expected. Drybulk terminal - 1 Berthed, 4 waiting with 8-9 days waiting time expected. West port - 4 Conventional vessels berthed, 2 cement carriers berthed and discharging. 1 Wharf occupied by passenger vessel, 2 days waiting time expected.

MAURITIUS - port louis labour working normally. Two container vessels berthed discharging and loading, 4 general cargo vessels discharging. No idle vessels in port. 2 Vessels awaiting berths to discharge, 1 vessel dry-docked, 1 days berthing delay expected 7-8/11 due to bunching of vessels.

PAKISTAN - Karachi - Three vessels loading at berth (rice, rice bran), 6 discharging at berth (gas oil, sugar, sulphate, fertiliser, general cargo, jute). 7 Container vessels loading/discharging. 1 Rice vessel waiting to load, 9 waiting to discharge (general cargo, hsd, sugar, pig iron, fertiliser), 5 awaiting orders, 4 due. Up to 2 days delay.

PHILIPPINES, Nov 4 - Manila - South harbour - 12 Vessels discharging at berth, 9 discharging at anchorage. 5 Vessels waiting at outer anchorage to discharge. Average waiting times 1-2 days for vessels with draft greater than 9 metres and loa greater than 140 metres. No delays for vessels with draft less than 8.5 metres and loa less than 130 metres.

SIERRA LEONE, Nov 4 - Freetown - No labour problems. Two vessels berthed and operating of which 1 rice discharger, 1 container discharger, 1 bulk carrier anchored. No vessels due, no delays expected. Draft restrictions alongside berth 36 ft. 6 Ins. No restrictions on loa/beam. Vessels must endeavour to be in/out of port before 1900 hrs for security reasons.

SINGAPORE, Nov - Tanjong Pagar container terminal - 10 Container vessels berthed. Keppel terminal - 6 Container/general cargo vessels berthed. Pasir Panjang terminal - 11 Container/general cargo vessels berthed. Sembawang terminal - 1 general cargo vessel berthed. Jurong port - 2 Bulk cargo/steel/general cargo vessels berthed. Oil terminals/sbm buoys - 17 tanks berthed. Minimal berthing delays at all terminals/buoys/ports.

S.KOREA, Nov 5 - Inchon - 67 Vessels in port (49 berthed, 18 anchored) of which berthed, 9 general cargo, 8 logs, 5 containers, 3 wheat blending pellets, 3 cars, 3 steel, 3 plywood, 2 cottonseed meal, 2 corn, 2 scrap, 1 pig-iron, 1 granite, 1 talc, 1 coils, 1 tapioca, 1 steel plates, 1 soya beans, 1 silica sand, 1 copper. Vessels anchored, 4 containers, 3 cars, 2 steel, 2 general cargo, 1 rye, 1 sulphate, 1 logs, 1 sugar, 1 timber, 1 plywood, 1 pulp. 2 Days delay expected. Busan - 164 Vessels in port (49 berthed, 115 anchored including 57 laid-up) of which berthed 32 general cargo, 9 containers, 4 scrap, 4 coal. 58 Awaiting berth, 2 days delay expected.

Pohang - 32 In port (29 berthed, 3 anchored), of which berthed and discharging, 4 steel pipes, 4 scrap, 2 wire rods, 2 plate, 2 billets, 2 benzene, 1 coal, 1 flourspar, 1 coils, 1 hot briquette iron. 9 Steel vessels loading, 3 awaiting berths with approx. 1-2 days delay. Ulsan - 28 In port (24 berthed, 4 anchored) of which berthed and discharging, 2 wood-chip, 2 feed meal, 2 crude oil, 1 cement, 1 mono-ethyl glycol, 1 styrene monomer, 1 raw sugar, 1 steel pipes, 1 zinc concentrate, 1 copper concentrate, 1 chemicals, 1 corn, 1 propane. Vessels loading, 2 ammonium sulphate, 2 general cargo, 1 fertiliser, 1 cocosol, 1 molten sulphur, 1 naphtha 4 Vessels (1 wood-chip, 3 feed) waiting berths 3-10 days delay. Masan - 11 In port (all berthed) of which discharging, 2 steel scrap, 2 coils, 2 logs, 1 pig-iron, 1 tapioca, 1 containers, 1 steel slabs. 1 Container vessel loading, no berthing delays.

SRI LANKA, Nov 5 - Colombo - Seven vessels due, 72 hours delay expected. 11 Vessels loading at berth of which 1 essential services, 10 containers. 20 Vessels discharging at berth of which 1 bagged sugar, 5 bagged rice, 2 general cargo, 1 bagged flour, 10 container vessels, 1 bagged rice and maize. No vessels discharging at anchorage, none waiting at anchorage to load. 18 vessels waiting at anchorage to discharge of which 13 containers (discharging/loading), 5 general cargo, 1 bunkering, 2 under repair, 4 in drydock. 5 Vessels awaiting orders. Shortage of stevedores to handle cargo on conventional/breakbulk vessels. Galle - One vessel loading at berth. Trincomalee - one vessel discharging at berth, 1 vessel loading at berth.

TAIWAN, Nov 1 - Keelung - Three vessels anchored. Berthing delays, grain/steel/iron ore 1 day, coal 4 days. Kaohsiung - Two anchored. Berthing delays gin 5 days, iron/coal 4 days (CSC berth). Coal/scrap 2 days (public berth). Steel 3 days. Taichung - Five vessels anchored. Berthing delays, grain 2-3 days, iron ore/coal/steel/others 1 day. No delays for scrap. Nov 4 - Keelung - 30 vessels in port of which 14 containers, 2 tankers, 10 other bulkers, 4 general cargo. 6 container vessels waiting at outer anchorage, 1 day's average berthing delay expected.
